metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6807 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: When a device was changed while a stream was about to be destroyed, the stream-reinit task may have been executed after the stream was destroyed, causing a use-after-free and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.6, Firefox < 74, Firefox < ESR68.6, and Firefox ESR < 68.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6807` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
